meanings.definition: Resembling a hawk in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The hawklike bird soared gracefully through the sky.
meanings.sent2: Her sharp eyes had a hawklike intensity when she spotted the rabbit.
meanings.sent3: The hawklike cat pounced on the toy mouse with precision.
meanings.sent4: His hawklike features made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The hawklike silhouette against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: Having the sharp vision or predatory instincts of a hawk.
meanings.sent1: The hawklike gaze of the detective never missed a detail.
meanings.sent2: The athlete had a hawklike focus during the competition.
meanings.sent3: The hawklike student quickly spotted the answer in the textbook.
meanings.sent4: Her hawklike instincts warned her of danger ahead.
meanings.sent5: The hawklike precision of his aim impressed everyone at the archery range.
